p: Human schistosomiasis is caused by infection, mainly with one of 4 species of the blood fluke belonging to Schistosomatoidea. It is estimated that there are over 200 million cases annually in Africa, with two-thirds being Schistosoma haematobium and the remainder S. mansoni. In Southeast Asia, other species such as S. japonicum and S. mekongi cause smaller numbers of infections [ 64]. The mortality associated with schistosomal infections is difficult to calculate. Comorbidities linked to anemia are common, and infection with S. haematobium can lead to female genital schistosomiasis, which results in increased susceptibility to HIV infection [ 65].
